reviews.review_msg: Great explainer, I learned more stats in this course than the actual stats course. Tells stories to keep the class entertaining and very patient when asking questions. Only thing I personally didn't like was having to write the whole paper from a sole "how to" link despite the fact that it's 50%, but that's to do with class setup than Richard

Richard is AMAZING! he makes boring material interesting and he is very caring and helpful. One thing you should be aware of when taking a class with him is the style of his exams. He tests more on technical concepts for example designing a study with some given information. overall he is a great prof and strongly recommended

Richard is such a goofy guy. Keeps lectures interesting with his many stories. His tests are fair and more application based rather than memorizing. 304 and 303 are basically the same class... would definitely recommend taking them together or 304 first (it'll help with the stats side of 303). No textbook, his readings are free but not necessary.

Richard is by far the most caring prof i have ever had. He always finds ways to make lectures interesting by telling stories and jokes. His exams may seem taunting but if you do the readings, you will be fine. Love this prof, take any classes with him if you can!
GREATEST PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME. If you haven't had him for a class you are missing out!!

Richard is a nice guy. The course material wasn't too bad, but I found the lecture slides very empty and confusing. He also uses tons of british terminology which can be quite annoying!! Overall he's a good professor though.

he's passionate about the material but doesn't know how to teach. just makes jokes and tells stories during lecture. his powerpoints don't help with the exams and worst of all, the lab reports can be unclear of what's expected. would not recommend

Great prof and really works to make the class interesting. The exams weren't particularly easy but if you regularly review the content and pay attention in class you'll do great! No textbook so it was hard to get focused on the class.

Great prof! Very fun which makes the class more interesting, but he also just teaches interesting material in the first place, so it was easy to follow along with sometimes he cuts class short which is awesome , other times he uses the full time. Just depends on the amount of material for that week. No textbook! just his links that arent too long!

The course content is very dry but the course as a whole is not mind blowing hard. All thats needed is to get him on your good side and make him feel bad for you then you will get extra marks if not a whole letter grade higher!! No lie!!!!!

Richard is an absolute delight! His exams are challenging and his lecture slides are designed so that you HAVE to attend class but if you go and pay attention and know all the details, you will do fine on his broad exam questions. His stories are hilarious and he's extremely approachable.

Ward is a pretty easy going professor, and understands that the material that he teaches is fairly dry. His lectures include a lot of extraneous information and he cracks many jokes, which is a way to keep the lectures somewhat interesting and entertaining. Focus on the slides, the readings are purely supplementary. I liked him though, cool guy.
Richard is the best teacher in the KIN department no doubt too bad the material he teachs isn't so interesting unless you like doing stats. KIN 303/304
Pretty much his lab for KIN 303 is a copyright "That's what she said!" You have something to look forward to for sure! haha

RICHARD IS SO AWESOME!  303 and 304 are essentially the same class, I don't know why they even have them separately?  Easy A for both classes if you pay attention in class and are good with computers.

Richard's overall rating on this website is misleading. He deserves top marks for his teaching/lecturing skills and helpfulness. The material he teaches in both 303 and 304 is a bit dry, but he does what he can to make it interesting and explains it very well. Have to understand the material and apply it during exams.

You cant not love richard. He kinda looks like a plump cocker spaniel. Very personable, tries very hard to make a dull course exciting. SPOILER: he succeeds. Would absolutly take another course with him. Exams are a little vague, but pay attention to what he says in class. Funny stories, funny jokes ect. final is 1/2 open book so keep copious notes

I hate stats, but Richard is incredible!!!!! He's so much fun, and keeps you laughing.  The material is rediculously boring though.  Too much stats, and the computer midterms are kinda intimidating.  The final paper is huge and he doesn't give much time to do it... start working on it immediately!
this man is hilarious! although i hate stats, but he explains the material quite well. lots of writing and computer stuff (excel, SPSS) but overall, a useful class.

Really nice guy and very helpful. The material in the class, however, is really dry. Those 2 hour lectures are tough to stay awake through. The assignment and final paper take longer than you would expect...so start them early.

kin304- if you want your GPA to drop take his course. He will tell that you a topic is not important but it shows up on the final. Kin 375- Don't take it through distance, massive reading. The final and midterm are 2-3 pages essay answers per question and questions are opened-ended. Be prepare to write until you drop in his class.
Rich ward gives great advice on time management! Great job Rich! His advice is larger than life

The material is super easy but his marking on exams is weird.  His questions are worth more than there is to write about them which makes it hard to know what he wants....I also felt he favoured athletes
People on suicide watch should not take this course cause they'll be dead 2 weeks in.  Super nice guy but I'd rather do poetry than learn anthro... ok maybe it isn't that bad but close enough.
Richard is wonderfull and really cares about his students.  he takes the time!
